userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James Macoughty Papers, Manuscript MS 75.3, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Macoughty was a portrait painter in western Virginia between 1828 and 1834.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: A bill, October 26, 1831, to Thomas Palmer for two portrait frames, and a receipt, December 19, 1831, to Mrs Sarah P[endleton] Dandridge for money paid for portraits of her and her son. Both items are written from Baltimore, Md.
